data.title: CHINESE ON WAY TO TIBETAN CAPITAL
data.meta_description: LONDON, October 31 (A.A.P.) .â€”Chinese Communist, forces have penetrated 100 miles into Tibet in their drive towards the capital of Lhasa, The Tibetan troops have fallen ...
data.text:
The Tibetan troops have fallen

back to points 200 milts east of

Lhasa.

Indian officials In the capital

say that to cover this 200 miles

usua.ly takes caravans a month,

but it can be done In a fortnight.

Chinese sources in Hong Kong

with Tibetan connections believe

that if no outside aid 1b forthcoming,

tbe invading troops will

occupy Tibet within five weeks.

General Lin Po-chea, the oneeyed

Communist'

commander-inchief.

is

believed to

be using

50,000

troops in the

drive on

TibeL

FORTRESS FALLS

Tbe Tibetan Government

has

confirmed

through

tbe

Indian

trade agent at Lhasa,. Mr. Sinha,

that certain frontier posts

have

fallen, including the

important

fortress of Chamdo, a keystone in

Tibet's defences, about 600 miles

north-eaBt of Lhasa.

Lhasa says that the

Chinese

troops have

advanced

beyond

Chamdo.

The Dalai Lama is ready to

Cee to India and the party will

travel by pack mule. The Journey

to India will take at least three

weeks and enow Is due in a fortnight.

A Tibetan trader who was in

Lhasa last week said in Kalimpong

(India) that Tibetan Government

troops were not likely

to otter resistance, because the

Chinese troops were heading for

Lhasa in the name of the Panchen

Lama.

Reports from New Delhi say

that the Tibetan Government hag

asked was the Indian Government for

"diplomatic help," such as facilities

to negotiate with Peiping,

but not for military assistance or

reference to the U.N. Security

Council

India does not Intend to raise

the Question of Tibet before the

U.K., but it will probably try to

mediate with Felping.
